TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CodeChecksumPragma extends System.CodeDom.CodeDirective

Docs.summary: Represents a code checksum pragma code entity.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CodeChecksumPragma class inherits from <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirective> and can be contained in a <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeDirectiveCollection>. CodeChecksumPragma provides the unique identification of source files, including files that have been generated.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the CodeChecksumPragma class.
[!code-vb[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.codedom.codeche_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.codedom.codeche_1.cs)]

remarks.format:

[!code-vb[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.codedom.codeche_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.codedom.codeche_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public CodeChecksumPragma (string fileName, Guid checksumAlgorithmId, byte[] checksumData);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string fileName, valuetype System.Guid checksumAlgorithmId, unsigned int8[] checksumData) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to the checksum file.
A <xref:System.Guid> that identifies the checksum algorithm to use.
A byte array that contains the checksum data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a file name, a GUID representing the checksum algorithm, and a byte stream representing the checksum data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information on the `checksumAlgorithmId` parameter, see the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeChecksumPragma.ChecksumAlgorithmId%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the CodeChecksumPragma constructor. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeChecksumPragma> class.
[!code-vb[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/30b00eb5-b05c-4a58-b7b4-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/30b00eb5-b05c-4a58-b7b4-_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a GUID that identifies the checksum algorithm to use.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Guid> that identifies the checksum algorithm to use.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Algorithms are provided for the MD5 and SHA1 hashes. The GUID value to use for the MD5 hash is {0x406ea660, 0x64cf, 0x4c82, 0xb6, 0xf0, 0x42, 0xd4, 0x81, 0x72, 0xa7, 0x99}. The GUID to use for the SHA1 hash is {0xff1816ec, 0xaa5e, 0x4d10, 0x87, 0xf7, 0x6f, 0x49, 0x63, 0x83, 0x34, 0x60}.
The calculation of the checksum is language-specific. That is, the language vendor can use any of the hashing algorithms known to the debugger to calculate the checksum. The use of a GUID for this property provides hash algorithm extensibility.
## Examples The following code example shows the setting of the ChecksumAlgorithmId property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeChecksumPragma> class.
[!code-vb[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.codedom.codeche_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.codedom.codeche_0_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the data for the checksum calculation.
Docs.value: A byte array that contains the data for the checksum calculation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ChecksumData property contains data from the target file specified by the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeChecksumPragma.FileName%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example shows the setting of the ChecksumData property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeChecksumPragma> class
[!code-vb[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.codedom.codeche_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.CodeDom.CodeDirectives#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.codedom.codeche_1_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the path to the checksum file.
Docs.value: The path to the checksum file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An example of a FileName property value is "C:\Temp\Test\OuterLinePragma.txt".
## Examples The following code example shows the setting of the FileName property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeChecksumPragma> class
